div.p:
Whereas heretofore there hath bene a Comission awarded to divers
Comissioners uppon the Statute of Charitable uses to enquire Within
the said Cytty of Bristoll and County of the Same and to make
orders and Decrees according to the said Statute And whereas by
vertue thereof an Inquision hath bene found concerneing certine
and Tenementes called the Bartholomewe land heretofore
given and appointed for the perpetuall maintenance and contyuewance
of a free grammer schole erected in the howse of the Bartholmewes in
Bristoll aforesaid whereuppon the said Comissioners in that
behalfe appointed have ordered adiudged and decreed That
whereas the proffittes of the said land and Tenementes given and
appointed by pretexte of A ffee ffarme thereof graunted by the mayor
and Comminalitie of the said Cytty of Bristoll to one Nicholas
Thorne late father of the said Allice Pikes and to his heires
have bene onelie Thirtie poundes yearelie viztvidelicet Twenty poundes to the
Scholemaster and Tenne poundes to the Usher That the Scholemaster
should have yearelie the yearely wages of ffortye poundes and the
usher or x x Parchment scraped and two x added ushers twenty poundes Which wages should be raysed
of the yearelie profittes of the said landes and tenementes ( uniuste
incumbraunces being discharged ) over and above the dwellinge howses
of the Schoolemaster and usher As in and by the said Comission
Inquision and decree remayneinge in the Said Highe Courte of Chauncery
more att lardge appeareth An Where allsoe the said Complaynaunt
Allice Pikes ( beinge greeved with the said decree ) hath accordinge
to the Statute in that behalfe ordeyned not onelie exhibited
exceptions againste the Said Comissioners Inquison and decree
as by the same remayneinge of recorde in the office of the Pettye
Bagge in this honorable Courte may more att lardge appeare
But hath also preferred A bill of Complaynte in this Courte
against the said defendantes whoe have putt in Answeres to
those exceptions and bill And the Same Complaynaunte hath
replied to the same Aunsweres and perfect yssues have bene
ioyned thereuppon betwene the saide parties And A Comission
hath bene lately awarded to Richard Barkeley esquier and others
to examine witnesses thereuppon on both sides And the saide
Comissioners att A tyme and place did meete and attend thexecucion
of the said Comission accordinglie At which tyme ytt did appeare
that the Mayors of the saide Cyttie for the tyme beinge have
taken uppon them to be speciall Governours of the saide schoole
and did yearelie visitt the said scgole and choose ffower
overseers thereof And have and doe with the advice of the
Aldermen and Common councell of the said Cytty displace and
place from tyme to tyme the scholemaster and usher of the
saide schoole ( as occasion serveth ) And further ytt did appeare
to the saide Comissioners That the said Nicholas Thorne
father of the saide Complaynante being lawfully seized in his
Demeane as of ffee of divers other landes besides theies nowe in
question died thereof doe seized without yssue male of his bodye
begotten haveinge yssue three daughters and heires To Whome all
the said Nicholas Thornes landes are discended namelie to this
Complaynante and to Katherine & and Myrabell her sisters after whose
death the said three Coheirs in Anno Quadragesimo Elizabeth
made particion and levyed a fyne severally either to other of them
severall parte soe allotted to them Whereby theis landes were
allotted to Allice the nowe Complaynaunte and to her heires And
other landes to the vallewe of Twelve hundred poundes cleere of all
Incumbraunces were alloted to the said Katherine and Myrabell
and to their heirs Whoe have together With their husband levied
ffynes and suffered recoveryes thereof and solde for greate sommes
of money to straungers all those landes soe allotted unto them
And over and besides Eleven poundes of yearlie rent Were allotted
to Katherine and Mirabell and their heires out of theis landes for
equalitie of particion And the whole rentes of theirs landes called the
Bartholomewe landes att this day but onely ffiftie three
poundes yeareley And the said Allice utterlie barred of all remedie
for anie parte of the other landes Which discended to her and her
sisters as coheirs from her ffather uppon theis reasons the saide
Comissioners intreated the said Mayor and Commalyte to growe
to some chartitable end of all suites With the said Complaynante
and to relinquishe the benefitt of the said Decree made by the
saide Comissiomers uppon the statute of Charitable Uses And
thereuppon the saide Maior and Commalitye beinge moved with
the remembrance of the manifolde good actes and deedes of Charytye
done by the Auncestors of the saide Allice Pykes unto and within
the said Cytte over and besides the errecion and foundacion of
this saide schole And alsoe weighinge what a valluable
consideracion in other landes she hath departed with to her sisters
and veiwinge her greate chardge haveinge seaven daughters
to provide for and hath onelie the said landes in question lefte
her have att and by the mocion and intreate of the saide
Comissioners and by a generall assent and agreement of all the
Saide parties thought fytt to permytt and Suffer the Said Alice
Pikes and her heires to enioy the Saide landes and they are contented
to accepte the yearlie rent of ffortie poundes out of theis landes for the maynetenance of the Saide scholemaster and Usher of this schole
and Twenty Sixe Shillinges eighte pence to and for the reperacions
of the Saide scholehowse yearely soe as the Saide Complaynance
Shall within next cominge pay all Such arrearages of rent due
out of theis landes as are nowe behinde to the Maior and
Cominaltye and Shall Well and trewlie Satisfie and paye
to the Said Maior and Comminalty and to their succesors the severall
yearelie Sommes of money and rentes of ffortie poundes and Twentye
Sixe Shillinges eight pence att the ffeastes of the birth of sainte John
Baptiste sainte Michaell Tharchaungell the ffeaste of the Nativitie
of our lorde god and the Annuiacion of sainte Mary the Virgin by
wen and equall porcions yearely and perpetually without any
defaulte therein att any to be comitted All which the Said Allice
Pykes the Complaynance hath agreed to paye and performe
accordinglie wheretofore aswell the said Complte as also the
Saide defendauntes for the finall determinacion of the said controversied
and for the perfecte setleinge and assureinge of the Said landes and
premisses and of the Said Severall yearelie rentes accordinglie, have
agreed that ytt shalbe in all thinges ratifyed established and
confirmed by the decree of this honorable Courte It is therefore
this present day beinge the one and twentieth day of Maye in the
eighte yeare of his maiesties raigne ordered decreed and adiudged by the
right honourable Thomas Lorde Ellesmere Lord Chauncellor of England
and ny the Said Courte of Chauncery With the consent of all the
Said parties and of their Councell and Attorneyes That the Saide
Allice Pykes her heires and Assignes and the Tenauntes ffarmors and
Occupiers of the Said landes called the Bartholomewe landes for
the tyme beinge shall well and trewely satisfie and pay the Saide
severall yearelie rentes of ffortie pound and Twenty Sixe Shillinges
eight pence to the Maior and Comminaltie of the saide Cytty of
Bristoll and their successors out of the rentes and profittes of the
said landes to the uses of the schoolemaster and usher of the said schole for
the tyme beinge and for reperacions of the Saide schole Att the
Said ffower usuall ffeastes in the yeare That is to saye Att the
ffeaste of the Nativitie of sainte John Baptiste sainte Michaell
tharchaungell the byrth of our Lorde god and the Annunciacion of Saintes
Marye the Virgin by even and equall porcions And the said severall
Sommes shalbe soe paied for ever in manner and forme followinge
That is to say To the scholemaster there for the tyme beinge
onelie ffortie markes and to the Usher there onelie Twentie
markes and to &and for the reparacions of the Saide scholehowse sixe
and Twentie Shillinges eight pence yearlie att the saide fower
usuall termes in the year ( vi⁊t videlicet ) the ffeaste of the Nativitie of
sainte John the Baptiste sainte Michall Tharchaungell the Nativity
of our Lord and the Annunciacion of the blessed Virgin Mary att the
Tolsey of Bristoll within the Said Cytty by even porcions And yf
the Said Allice Pykes her heires or Assignes shall not Satisfie and
pay the said yearelie rentes or somm of money within Twentie eighte
dayes nexte after anie of the saide ffeaste dayes accordinge to the
true meaneinge hereof Then the said Allice Pikes and her heires
shall for everu such faulte forefeite and pay the said mayor
and Cominality of the saide Cytty of Bristoll and their successors
the somme of ffortie shillinges And if they shall not satisfie all
the said rentes and arreareges thereof and all ( nomine penes ) soe as
aforesaid to be forfeited to the said Maior and Cominalitie and
to their successors or to their Chamberlayne or their authorished
Atturney to and for the use aforesaid by the space of halfe a
yeare nexte after anie parte of the said severall sommes shalbe
growe due by the treww meaneinge hereof That then yt shall be
lawfull for them the saide Mayor a Cominalitie and their
successors or to their Chamberlayne or authorished Atturney to
reenter in all the said landes called the Bartholemewe landes scituate
lieinge and beinge within the said Cytty of Bristoll and Countie
of the same and within the County of Gloucester and the same
and every parte thereof to enioye and reteyne until the saide
severall sommes and rentes and all ( nomine penes ) and all arreareges
therof and of every parte thereof shalbe fullie satisfied and
paied And the said Allice Pikes and her heires and assignes
shall and will quietlie permitt and suffer the Mayor and Comminality
of the saide Cytty of Bristoll and their successors to occupie
and enioye the same from tyme to tyme accordinglie And further
yt is decreed that she the said Complaynaunye her executors and
assignes shall pay all such arreareges of rent as are nowe due out
of the saide landes and behinde and unpaied to the saide Mayor and
Commynalitie to their Chamberlayne att the Tolsey as the same shall
be caste upp by the Chamberlayne of the saide Cytty of Bristoll for
the tyme beinge within one moneth after the feaste of sainte Michaell
Tharchaungell nowe nexte ensueinge And yt is further Ordered and
decreed that she the said Allice Pikes her heirs and assignes under the
rentes and paymentes before expressed shall and lawfullie may for ever
hereafter quietly and peaceablely have hold possesse and enioye all
the saide landes calld the Bartholomewe landesscituate and beinge
within the said Cytty of Bristoll and Countie of the same and
within the County of Gloucester Excepte the said Scholehowse
and such roomes and places as are excepted in the graunte of
ffee ffarme thereof heretofore made by the said Mayor and
Cominaltie to the said Nicholas Thorne deceased father of the
said Allice and to her heires And yt is further Ordered and
decreed that the Maiors of the Cyttie for the tyme being for
ever hereafter shall bee speciall Governours of the said schoole
as they in tymes paste have bene And shall yearelie visitt the said
schoole and choose overseers thereof as they in tymes paste have
done And shall and may from tyme to tyme with the advise of the
Aldermen and Common Councell there for ever hereafter as often as
they shall see occasion displace and place the scholemaster and
usher of the saide schoole and every or either or anie of them frely
withoute any rewarde takeing therefore and shall and may from tyme
to tyme make such orders and rules for the bringing upp and
educacion of youth there in Learninge of Grammer and other good
Litterature as to them shall seme fytt soe as they bee not repugnant
to the lawes Ordinances rules and Goverment there sett downe
by the founders thereof And ytt is further Orderes and decreed that
onely ffower pence from tyme to tyme and att all tymes hereafter
shalbee by the scholemaster of the said schoole for the tyme being
of every scholler taken for his firste Admission into the saide schoole
and in such forme ffreelie to be taughte as by the ffounders is sett
dowen And all the premisses herein sett downe shalbee done and
performed on all partes and shall have continuance for ever The
afore recited Decres made by the said Comissioners or any thinge
therein conteined to the contrary thereof in any wise notwithstandinge /
